procedures.title: Initial Installation
steps: Mount the ZEN 150 unit using provided brackets
Connect 48V DC power supply to terminals
Verify ground connection
Power on unit
Confirm touch screen responds
procedures.expected_outcome: Unit powers on with responsive touch screen

procedures.title: Touch Screen Calibration
steps: Enter settings menu
Select calibration option
Touch indicated points on screen
Confirm calibration accuracy
Save settings
procedures.expected_outcome: Touch screen responds accurately to input

procedures.title: Maintenance Cleaning
steps: Use soft, lint-free cloth
Apply approved screen cleaner sparingly
Wipe screen gently
Dry with clean cloth
Power on unit
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean, clear screen surface

procedures.title: First Start Up Procedure
preconditions: All connections must be properly made
steps: Perform preliminary checks before startup
Verify all hydraulic connections
Check electrical connections
Confirm power supply voltage
procedures.expected_outcome: System ready for initial operation

procedures.title: Pump Group Installation
steps: Position pump group in designated location
Secure pump group to mounting surface
Connect hydraulic lines
Verify proper mounting
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump group securely installed and connected

procedures.title: Remote Control Panel Installation
steps: Mount control panel in designated location
Route control cables
Make electrical connections
Verify proper mounting
procedures.expected_outcome: Control panel properly mounted and connected

procedures.title: Seawater Intake Installation
steps: Connect seawater intake to seacock
Install strainer
Route intake piping to watermaker
Secure all connections
procedures.expected_outcome: Seawater intake system properly installed

procedures.title: Brine Discharge Installation
steps: Connect discharge line to watermaker
Route discharge piping
Connect to hull fitting
Secure all connections
procedures.expected_outcome: Brine discharge system properly installed

procedures.title: Manual Structure Understanding
preconditions: Have access to manual COD.150Z48.T.2024 EN
steps: Locate chapter number at start of section
Find paragraph numbers under chapter (format: X.X)
Navigate to subtitles under paragraphs (format: X.X.X)
Look for further subtitles if present (format: X.X.X.X)
Note that figure and table numbering restarts with each chapter
procedures.expected_outcome: User can effectively navigate and reference manual content

procedures.title: Understanding Warning Symbols
steps: Identify ATTENTION symbol for accident prevention warnings
Identify CAUTION symbol for system damage warnings
Identify NOTE symbol for useful information
procedures.expected_outcome: User can recognize and interpret all safety and information symbols

procedures.title: Normal Operating Without Final Flushing
steps: Start system
Run without final flush cycle
procedures.expected_outcome: System operates normally without flush

procedures.title: Normal Operating With Final Flushing
steps: Start system
Run normal cycle
Execute final flush
procedures.expected_outcome: System operates with final flush cycle

procedures.title: Working Cycle with Timer
steps: Set timer
Start timed cycle
procedures.expected_outcome: System operates on timer schedule

procedures.title: Long Flushing Procedure
steps: Initiate extended flush cycle
procedures.expected_outcome: Extended system flush completed

procedures.title: Reset Procedure
steps: Power down system
Wait specified time
Restart system
procedures.expected_outcome: System reset to default state

procedures.title: Filter Cleanliness Check
steps: Inspect filter
Clean or replace if necessary
procedures.expected_outcome: Filter confirmed clean and functional

procedures.title: Plant Working Pressure Check
steps: Monitor pressure gauges
Verify within specifications
procedures.expected_outcome: Pressure confirmed within normal range

procedures.title: Leak Check
steps: Inspect all connections
Check for water leakage
procedures.expected_outcome: No leaks detected

procedures.title: Membrane Replacement Check
steps: Check membrane condition
Verify performance
procedures.expected_outcome: Membrane condition assessed

procedures.title: Shutdown Procedure
steps: Follow shutdown sequence
Secure system
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly shut down

procedures.title: Antifreeze Procedure
steps: Drain system
Add antifreeze
Protect components
procedures.expected_outcome: System protected from freezing

procedures.title: Membrane Replacement
steps: Remove old membrane
Install new membrane
Test system
procedures.expected_outcome: New membrane installed and functioning

procedures.title: Pre-Operation Safety Check
preconditions: Manual must be available and accessible
steps: Read entire instruction manual carefully
Verify manual is complete and legible
Ensure manual is accessible to all operators
Confirm manual location is known to all relevant personnel
procedures.expected_outcome: Operator is fully informed of safety requirements and operation procedures

procedures.title: Personal Protective Equipment Protocol
steps: Select protective equipment appropriate for service operation
Ensure clothing is tight to body
Verify clothing is resistant to cleaning products used
Put on all required protective equipment
procedures.expected_outcome: Operator is properly protected for service operations

procedures.title: Installation Verification
steps: Contact Schenker service point
Verify electric connections meet specifications
Verify hydraulic connections meet specifications
Check for any leaks in the system
Confirm installation location prevents damage from potential leaks
procedures.expected_outcome: Plant is correctly installed and safe for operation

procedures.title: Initial Installation
steps: Mount the ZEN 150 unit using provided brackets
Connect 48V DC power supply to terminals
Verify ground connection
Power on unit
Confirm touch screen responds
procedures.expected_outcome: Unit powers on with responsive touch screen

procedures.title: Touch Screen Calibration
steps: Enter settings menu
Select calibration option
Touch indicated points on screen
Confirm calibration accuracy
Save settings
procedures.expected_outcome: Touch screen responds accurately to input

procedures.title: Maintenance Cleaning
steps: Use soft, lint-free cloth
Apply approved screen cleaner sparingly
Wipe screen gently
Dry with clean cloth
Power on unit
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean, clear screen surface

steps: Perform preliminary checks before startup
Verify all hydraulic connections
Check electrical connections
Confirm power supply voltage
procedures.expected_outcome: System ready for initial operation

procedures.title: Pump Group Installation
steps: Position pump group in designated location
Secure pump group to mounting surface
Connect hydraulic lines
Verify proper mounting
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump group securely installed and connected

procedures.title: Remote Control Panel Installation
steps: Mount control panel in designated location
Route control cables
Make electrical connections
Verify proper mounting
procedures.expected_outcome: Control panel properly mounted and connected

procedures.title: Seawater Intake Installation
steps: Connect seawater intake to seacock
Install strainer
Route intake piping to watermaker
Secure all connections
procedures.expected_outcome: Seawater intake system properly installed

procedures.title: Brine Discharge Installation
steps: Connect discharge line to watermaker
Route discharge piping
Connect to hull fitting
Secure all connections
procedures.expected_outcome: Brine discharge system properly installed

steps: Locate chapter number at start of section

steps: Identify ATTENTION symbol for accident prevention warnings
Identify CAUTION symbol for system damage warnings
Identify NOTE symbol for useful information

Run without final flush cycle

steps: Check membrane condition
Verify performance

procedures.title: Shutdown Procedure
steps: Follow shutdown sequence
Secure system
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly shut down

procedures.title: Antifreeze Procedure
steps: Drain system
Add antifreeze
Protect components
procedures.expected_outcome: System protected from freezing

procedures.title: Membrane Replacement
steps: Remove old membrane
Install new membrane
Test system
procedures.expected_outcome: New membrane installed and functioning

procedures.title: Pre-Operation Safety Check
preconditions: Manual must be available and accessible
steps: Read entire instruction manual carefully
Verify manual is complete and legible
Ensure manual is accessible to all operators
Confirm manual location is known to all relevant personnel
procedures.expected_outcome: Operator is fully informed of safety requirements and operation procedures

procedures.title: Personal Protective Equipment Protocol
steps: Select protective equipment appropriate for service operation
Ensure clothing is tight to body
Verify clothing is resistant to cleaning products used
Put on all required protective equipment
procedures.expected_outcome: Operator is properly protected for service operations

procedures.title: Installation Verification
steps: Contact Schenker service point
Verify electric connections meet specifications
Verify hydraulic connections meet specifications
Check for any leaks in the system
Confirm installation location prevents damage from potential leaks
procedures.expected_outcome: Plant is correctly installed and safe for operation

procedures.title: Periodic Leak Inspection
steps: Visually inspect all connections
Check for water leaks
Verify leak containment measures are in place
Document any findings
procedures.expected_outcome: No leaks present in system

procedures.title: Operation Safety Protocol
steps: Verify sea water is not polluted
Ensure no children or inexperienced people have access to plant
Confirm all safety devices are in place
Verify accident prevention protection is active
procedures.expected_outcome: Plant is safe for operation

procedures.title: Warranty Claim Procedure
preconditions: Equipment must be within 12-month warranty period from delivery date
ERS device must be within 36-month warranty period
Maintenance must have been performed by authorized Schenker technician
Equipment must not have been dismantled by unauthorized personnel
steps: Identify faulty parts requiring replacement/repair
Contact authorized Schenker Service point
Arrange transportation of equipment to Service Point at customer expense
For on-vessel repairs, schedule authorized technician visit
Customer pays for manpower and travel expenses for on-site repairs
Customer handles transportation risks for warranty parts
procedures.expected_outcome: Replacement or repair of faulty parts under warranty coverage

procedures.title: Technical Modification Procedure
preconditions: Technical changes affecting operation or safety are required
Must be performed by manufacturer's technical staff or authorized technicians only
steps: Contact manufacturer's technical staff or authorized technician
Do not attempt modifications without proper authorization
Allow only authorized personnel to perform technical changes
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe and authorized technical modifications to equipment

procedures.title: Watermaker Operation in Contaminated Water Prevention
preconditions: Water conditions must be assessed before operation
steps: Check water for silt or contamination before operation
Avoid operating in silty or contaminated water
Use only genuine Schenker spare parts
Perform regular general maintenance as specified in Section 6
procedures.expected_outcome: Prevention of damage to internal components and maintained efficiency

procedures.title: Fire Prevention and Response
preconditions: Fire extinguisher must be readily available
steps: Keep machine clean and free from debris
Check electrical wiring and connections regularly
Look for loose or damaged wiring
If fire occurs, turn off power supply immediately
Use appropriate fire extinguisher to contain and extinguish flames
Perform regular machine inspections
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe operation with minimized fire risk

procedures.title: Electrical Safety Protocol
steps: Verify electrical requirements before operation
Ensure use of grounded electrical outlet
Inspect wiring for damage before operation
Do not operate with frayed or damaged wiring
If electrical shock occurs, turn off power immediately
Contact professional assistance if electrical issues arise
Monitor for unusual smells or smoke
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe electrical operation without incidents

procedures.title: Flood Prevention Protocol
steps: Monitor system during operation
Check all hoses and connections for tightness
Inspect for signs of wear or damage
Listen for unusual noises
Turn off system immediately if leaks detected
Replace filters regularly
Check membranes for wear or damage
Perform regular system inspections
procedures.expected_outcome: Prevention of flooding incidents

procedures.title: Watermaker Installation
steps: Follow installation instructions in manual
Ensure system is properly set up
Verify all components are correctly installed
Have professional technician perform or verify installation
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed and functioning watermaker system

procedures.title: Regular Maintenance Protocol
steps: Follow maintenance schedule in manual
Perform routine inspections
Complete necessary repairs promptly
Document all maintenance activities
procedures.expected_outcome: Well-maintained watermaker system with minimized risk of failure

procedures.title: Locating Serial Number
steps: Locate the top valve of the unit
Find label on top valve
Read serial number from label
procedures.expected_outcome: Successful identification of watermaker unit serial number

procedures.title: General Safety for Transport and Handling
preconditions: Equipment must be transported in cardboard box
Proper lifting equipment must be available
Personal protective equipment must be available
steps: Wear appropriate protective equipment
Select lifting equipment suitable for weight and size of box
Verify lifting equipment is in good condition and maintained
Check attachment points for loading devices
Ensure no personnel are standing or passing under lifted equipment
Follow handling instructions in manual
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe transport and handling of watermaker unit

procedures.title: Materials Handling Specifications
preconditions: Watermaker unit must be in cardboard box packaging
steps: Verify package dimensions: Length 87cm
Verify package width: 64cm
Verify package height: 55cm
Confirm package weight: 80kg
procedures.expected_outcome: Correct identification and handling of packaged watermaker unit

procedures.title: Machine Disposal and Material Segregation
preconditions: Machine must be at end of life/decommissioned
Local disposal regulations must be consulted
steps: Verify machine is fully decommissioned
Dismantle the machine completely
Segregate stainless steel components
Segregate plastic components
Segregate carbon fibre components
Segregate motors, cables and electrical materials
Segregate rubber and polyurethane seals
Dispose of each material category according to local regulations
procedures.expected_outcome: Machine materials properly segregated and disposed of according to environmental regulations

procedures.title: Regulatory Compliance Verification
preconditions: Machine is in operation or being installed
steps: Verify compliance with Machinery Directive 2006/42/EC
Verify compliance with Low Voltage Directive 73/23/EEC and 93/68/CEE
Verify compliance with Electromagnetic Compatibility Directive 89/336/EEC and 93/31/CEE
Verify compliance with UNI EN 292/1 and 292/2 safety standards
Verify compliance with Supply of Machinery Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008:1597)
Verify compliance with Electrical Equipment Regulations 2016 (S.I. 2016:1101)
Verify compliance with Electromagnetic Compatibility Regulations 2016 (S.I. 2016:1091)
procedures.expected_outcome: Machine confirmed compliant with all applicable safety and regulatory standards

procedures.title: Storage Requirements
preconditions: Unit must be prepared for storage
steps: Select a dry storage location
Ensure storage temperature remains between 5°C and 45°C
Protect system from freezing temperatures to prevent fluid freezing
Place unit in selected storage location
procedures.expected_outcome: Unit safely stored without risk of temperature damage

procedures.title: Packaging Contents Verification
steps: Locate and verify Watermaker Pump group
Check for Active carbon filter with electrovalve
Verify presence of 5 microns filter with accumulator
Locate Mesh filter
Confirm Non-return valve with Tee fitting
Check for Remote panel
Verify 10mt extension cable for remote panel
Locate Installation kit
Check for Filter key
Verify 6x8 hose for production
Confirm Computer box presence
procedures.expected_outcome: All package contents verified and accounted for

procedures.title: Document Review and Installation Preparation
steps: Locate technical documentation in packaging
Review use and maintenance manual thoroughly before installation
Verify presence of electric and hydraulic schemes
Check for warnings and instruction documents
procedures.expected_outcome: Complete understanding of installation requirements and documentation

procedures.title: Material Verification
steps: Review manual for recommended materials list
Verify correct hoses are available
Confirm appropriate fittings are present
Validate seals match specifications
procedures.expected_outcome: All installation materials verified as compliant with manual specifications

procedures.title: Storage Temperature Management
steps: Identify storage location
Verify storage temperature range is between 5°C and 45°C
Monitor storage temperature regularly
Relocate unit if temperature limits are exceeded
procedures.expected_outcome: Unit stored within safe temperature range

procedures.title: Energy Recovery System Operation
preconditions: System must be connected to power source
steps: Activate low-pressure pump
Allow Energy Recovery System to amplify pressure
System automatically recoups hydraulic energy from membranes
No manual pressure adjustments needed during operation
procedures.expected_outcome: Silent, vibration-free water purification with high energy efficiency

procedures.title: Basic System Setup
preconditions: Manual must be accessible for reference
System must be in designated installation location
steps: Review operating procedures in manual
Review maintenance procedures in manual
Ensure system is properly connected
Verify power supply connection
procedures.expected_outcome: System ready for operation with operator familiar with procedures

procedures.title: Hydraulic Connection Setup - Main Unit
steps: Connect seawater inlet using 20mm internal diameter reinforced hose
Connect brine discharge using 16mm internal diameter reinforced hose
Connect fresh water line using 6x8mm hose to ¼'' fitting
procedures.expected_outcome: All hydraulic connections properly secured and leak-free

procedures.title: Hydraulic Connection Setup - Pump
steps: Connect water inlet using 20mm internal diameter reinforced hose
Connect water outlet using 16mm internal diameter reinforced hose
Install 5 micron cartridge filter (2.32" x 9 ¾")
Install active carbon filter (2.32" x 9 ¾")
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump connections complete and filters installed

procedures.title: Power System Setup
steps: Verify power supply meets 48 VDC +/- 15% requirement
Connect power supply ensuring proper polarity
Verify power consumption does not exceed 600 Watt/h average
Ensure peak power capacity of 1.2 KWatt is available
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly powered within specifications

procedures.title: Water Safety Maintenance
steps: Follow proper shutdown procedures after each use
Perform regular cleaning procedures
Install UV sterilizer or microfiltration system as backup treatment
Monitor water quality regularly
procedures.expected_outcome: Maintained water purity and system cleanliness

procedures.title: Routine System Monitoring
steps: Monitor system operation regularly
Perform routine maintenance checks
Verify safe operation
Check system effectiveness
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe and effective watermaker operation

procedures.title: Watermaker Component Identification
steps: Locate watermaker outlet/discharge
Locate watermaker inlet
Identify reverse osmosis membranes
Locate fresh water production area
Identify reset valve
Locate positioner knob
Find signal pressure switch
Locate manometer
Identify depressurization valve
procedures.expected_outcome: All major watermaker components identified and located

procedures.title: Accumulator Air Pressure Check
preconditions: Access to accumulator Schrader valve required
steps: Locate the polypropylene air reservoir (accumulator)
Check air pressure through Schrader valve
Verify pressure is approximately 5 Bar
If pressure is incorrect, adjust to factory specifications
procedures.expected_outcome: Accumulator maintains correct 5 Bar pre-charge pressure

procedures.title: High Pressure Safety Shutdown
steps: Monitor pump pressure through pressure switch
If pressure exceeds 15 bar:
System automatically shuts down
High-pressure alarm activates on control panel
Investigate cause of high pressure
Reset system once pressure issue is resolved
procedures.expected_outcome: System shuts down safely when pressure exceeds 15 bar

procedures.title: System Safety Monitoring
steps: Do not leave system running unattended for extended periods
Regularly monitor system operation
Maintain proper control checks
Monitor pressure sensor readings
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe and controlled system operation

procedures.title: Air Bleeding Operation
steps: Locate the depressurization valve on top of the watermaker
Slightly unscrew the depressurization valve to open it
Allow air to bleed from system
Once complete, close valve by screwing completely in
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly bled of air

procedures.title: Hydraulic Block Reset Procedure
preconditions: System is in hydraulic block state
steps: Locate the reset valve with blue lever on top of ERS
Open reset valve (move lever parallel to valve)
Locate the positioner (stainless steel arm with black knob)
Screw in the positioner to reset the unit
Close reset valve (return lever to perpendicular position)
procedures.expected_outcome: System released from hydraulic block

procedures.title: Emergency Manual Start Procedure
steps: Locate microswitches P1 and EV on computer box
Switch on P1 to activate pump
Switch on EV to activate electrovalve
Monitor system operation
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker operational in manual mode

procedures.title: Diverting Valve Installation
steps: Locate the salinity probe cables
Connect first probe cable to Salinity clamp on PCB
Connect second probe cable to Salinity clamp on PCB
Locate the diverting valve cables
Connect first valve cable to Chem clamp on PCB
Connect second valve cable to (-) clamp on PCB
procedures.expected_outcome: Diverting valve properly connected to control fresh water flow based on salinity readings

procedures.title: Diverting Valve Installation
steps: Locate the fresh water outlet from valve
Install diverting valve at the fresh water outlet point
Connect IN port to membrane outlet
Connect first OUT port to tank connection
Connect second OUT port to discharge connection
Install probe if included
procedures.expected_outcome: Diverting valve properly installed and connected to all required ports

procedures.title: Tee Discharge Connection Setup
steps: Locate the connection point from diverting valve
Connect tee fitting to diverting valve outlet
Connect one end to outboard discharge
Connect other end to watermaker discharge
procedures.expected_outcome: Tee discharge connection properly installed and connected

procedures.title: Pressure Transducer Installation
preconditions: Pressure transducer must be optional component
Access to watermaker inlet and electric box PCB required
steps: Install pressure transducer on the inlet of the watermaker
Connect red wire to clamp 12 on PCB
Connect green wire to clamp HP on PCB
procedures.expected_outcome: Pressure value readable on touch-screen display

procedures.title: Digital Flow Meter Installation
preconditions: Digital flow meter must be optional component
Access to watermaker outlet and electric box PCB required
steps: Identify proper flow direction using arrow on bottom of device
Connect meter to watermaker outlet hydraulically
If diverting valve present, install on inlet instead
Connect red wire to clamp 12 on PCB
Connect black wire to clamp (-) on PCB
Connect brown wire to clamp PrBa on PCB
procedures.expected_outcome: Fresh water production flow rate readable on touch-screen display

procedures.title: Active Carbon Filter Installation
steps: Connect filter between fresh water system and electrovalve on filter holder
Ensure manual valve is installed on filter inlet
Verify connections are secure
procedures.expected_outcome: Filter properly connected allowing cartridge replacement without system depressurization

procedures.title: Non-return Valve Installation
steps: Identify proper installation location
Install valve in vertical orientation only
Connect to inlet hose
Verify proper water flow direction
procedures.expected_outcome: Valve prevents water backflow and fresh water leakage during washing

procedures.title: Mesh Filter Installation
steps: Locate position between seacock and pump
Install mesh filter
Secure all connections
Verify proper water flow
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump protected from macro sediments

procedures.title: Electrovalve Operation
steps: Verify electrovalve connections
Switch from seawater intake position
Switch to fresh water tank position for washing
procedures.expected_outcome: Successful switching between seawater and fresh water sources

procedures.title: Pump Group Installation
preconditions: Horizontal base suitable to sustain pump weight needed
Location must be away from flammable materials and liquids
steps: Install pump below waterline if possible
Position pump within 2m maximum of water inlet
Ensure location prevents water damage in case of leaks
Place pump on horizontal base
Secure pump to support structure using passing bolts
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump group securely mounted in safe, accessible location

procedures.title: Watermaker Group Installation
steps: Position watermaker above pump location
Choose horizontal or vertical orientation
Apply supplied rubber-based adhesive to supporting surface
Place watermaker completely on flat surface
Secure watermaker using provided L-brackets
Ensure watermaker is not suspended by L-brackets alone
Install support shelf if needed for additional support
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker securely mounted with proper support and adhesion

procedures.title: Mounting Installation
steps: Check mounting orientation using Fig 4-2
Verify acceptable mounting configurations shown in Fig 4-3
Apply antivibration rubber stickers to mounting points
Mount unit according to approved configuration
procedures.expected_outcome: Unit securely mounted with vibration dampening

procedures.title: Watermaker Installation Planning
steps: Plan and evaluate equipment siting locations
Select seawater inlet/outlet positions
Determine positions for pump group, watermaker group, and active carbon filter
Plan position of thermal-magnetic circuit breaker
Plan routing paths for hoses and electric cables
Create schematic drawing of hydraulic and electric connections
Attach drawings to manual for reference
procedures.expected_outcome: Complete installation plan with all component locations mapped

procedures.title: Through-hull Fitting Installation
steps: Locate central and low position on hull
Ensure position prevents air suction into pump
Install through-hull fitting
Install non-return valve under seawater level
Position non-return valve close to through-hull fitting
Mount non-return valve in vertical position
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly positioned and sealed through-hull fitting with valve

procedures.title: Pump Installation
steps: Position pump as low as possible relative to waterline
Install pump within 2m of seawater intake
Ensure pump is in ventilated location for motor cooling
Avoid contact with flammable liquids and materials
Verify pump location is below waterline if distance exceeds 2m
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly positioned and secured pump installation

procedures.title: Watermaker Unit Mounting
steps: Identify location with ambient temperature not exceeding 40°C
Prepare support structure capable of holding 60 Kg
Position watermaker unit on support
Secure watermaker unit to support
procedures.expected_outcome: Securely mounted watermaker unit

procedures.title: Watermaker Unit Installation
steps: Verify rubber sticker positions according to chosen orientation (vertical or horizontal)
For horizontal installation, connect manometer horizontally using provided fittings
If mounting horizontally, use the following fittings in sequence:
- Install 1/2" M to 3/8" F reducer
- Connect 3/8" 90°-Degree Elbow
- Attach 3/8" Nipples
- Install 3/8" M to 1/4" F reducer
Ensure lateral manifolds are not stressed during installation
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker unit securely mounted with proper orientation and fittings

procedures.title: Hydraulic System Installation
preconditions: Access to boat's fresh water system
steps: Connect 'Armorvin' type hose with 16mm internal diameter for brine discharge
Install reinforced hose with minimum internal diameter of 20mm (PN16 rating)
Connect reinforced hose to pressure side of boat's fresh water system
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly connected hydraulic system with correct hose specifications for both brine discharge and fresh water supply

procedures.title: Housebarb Installation
preconditions: Access to right side of watermaker
steps: Locate plug on right side of watermaker
Remove plug using key #27
Install provided housebarb using key #24
Tighten until mechanical stop
Do not exceed torque limits
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed housebarb fitting

procedures.title: Non-Return Valve Installation
steps: Identify location as close as possible to seawater intake
Orient valve according to direction arrow
Install valve in vertical position
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed non-return valve

procedures.title: Active Carbon Filter Installation
preconditions: Active carbon filter with electrovalve available
steps: Position filter next to pump group
Mount in vertical position if possible
Ensure filter is easily accessible
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed active carbon filter

procedures.title: Seawater Intake Installation
steps: Locate central position well under waterline
Install 3/4" minimum size seacock
Install scoop skin fitting oriented toward bow
For boats exceeding 15 knots: drill 8mm hole on back of shape
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed seawater intake system

procedures.title: Seacock Water Inlet Installation
preconditions: Installation location must be below waterline
steps: Verify seacock is minimum 3/4" size
Ensure fitting is located low and central in hull
Confirm location is not forward of keel
Verify no air can be introduced from other systems
Confirm location remains underwater when vessel heels
Check distance from WC discharge is adequate
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly installed water inlet that meets all safety requirements

procedures.title: Hose Connection Installation
steps: Install mesh type filter (50 Mesh) near water intake
Secure connections below waterline with double hose clamps
Position strainer close to through-hull
Ensure strainer is accessible for inspection
procedures.expected_outcome: Secure and serviceable hose connections

procedures.title: Fresh Water Flushing Connection
preconditions: Access to boat's fresh water pressure pump
Minimum flow rate capability of 20 lit/min at 1 bar
steps: Tee into line downstream of fresh water pressure pump
Verify pump meets minimum flow requirements
Ensure fresh water pump is ON during flushing
procedures.expected_outcome: Functional fresh water flushing system

procedures.title: Brine Discharge Installation
preconditions: Access to discharge location above sea level
steps: Install discharge connection above sea level
Use minimum ½" BSP size fitting
Optional: Tee into existing discharge hoses
Verify no backflow of dirty water possible
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly functioning discharge system without backflow

procedures.title: Remote Control Panel Installation
preconditions: Must be performed by qualified technician/operator
Internal boat panel must be free of humidity and condensation
steps: Identify mounting location on boat panel
Verify area behind panel is free of humidity and condensation
Confirm minimum 50mm depth clearance behind panel
Cut opening in boat panel to dimensions: 110mm width x 90mm height
Connect pre-wired multiple cable (10m standard length)
Mount control panel (overall dimensions 135mm width x 116mm height)
procedures.expected_outcome: Remote control panel securely mounted with proper electrical connection

procedures.title: Hydraulic Connections Installation
preconditions: All required components present: pump, electrovalve, filters, valves
Access to vessel's fresh water system
steps: Install low pressure connections (max 3 bar) using Armorvin reinforced pipe PN 6 with 20mm internal diameter between seawater intake, mesh filter, non-return valve inlet, and pump group
Connect watermaker discharge to vessel's through hull discharge using Armorvin reinforced pipe PN6 with 16mm internal diameter
Install medium pressure connections (max 10 bar) using rubber reinforced pipe PN 20 (min) with 20mm internal diameter between fresh water system, carbon filter, backflow valve outlet, and pump inlet
Connect pump outlet to 5 microns filter and watermaker inlet using appropriate pressure-rated hose
Connect watermaker to fresh water tank using ¼'' fittings and small plastic blue pipe 6x8mm
procedures.expected_outcome: All hydraulic connections properly installed and secured with appropriate pressure ratings

procedures.title: Safety Requirements for Hydraulic Installation
steps: Verify all connections (except fresh water production) use 16mm internal diameter hose
Ensure pump outlet to 5m filter to watermaker inlet section uses minimum PN 16 reinforced hose
Verify all pressure ratings match connection requirements: Low pressure (max 3 bar), Medium pressure (max 10 bar)
Check all fittings are properly secured
Verify hose quality meets safety requirements
procedures.expected_outcome: All connections meet safety requirements and pressure ratings

procedures.title: Pump Connection Installation
preconditions: Pump must be positioned near seawater intake
Pump must be positioned as low as possible relative to seawater level
steps: Connect inlet hose to pump IN port
Connect outlet hose to pump OUT port
Ensure hose paths are short and straight (not convoluted)
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly connected pump with optimal hose routing

procedures.title: Watermaker Inlet Connection
steps: Locate holder on right side of watermaker marked 'IN'
Connect seawater inlet hose from pump to the IN holder
procedures.expected_outcome: Secure connection between pump and watermaker inlet

procedures.title: Watermaker Outlet Connection
steps: Locate holder on right side marked 'OUT'
Connect discharge hose to OUT holder
If drain outlet is below watermaker, create upward swan neck in hose to ensure water head
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper discharge connection with appropriate water head

procedures.title: Fresh Water Tank Connection
preconditions: Fresh water tank must be accessible
Supplied small hose must be available
steps: Locate polyethylene pipe on right side of watermaker
Connect supplied hose between watermaker pipe and tank
For metal tanks: Create 1/4" threaded hole if needed
Alternative: Connect to tank air vent hose using T-fitting
procedures.expected_outcome: Secure fresh water connection between watermaker and tank

procedures.title: 48V DC Electric Installation
steps: Refer to electrical scheme diagram FIG. 4-5
Connect power supply to 48V DC terminals
Verify proper voltage at connection points
Follow wiring diagram for component connections
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper 48V DC electrical connection established according to scheme

procedures.title: 48V DC Wiring Installation
steps: Verify power is disconnected
Connect positive (+) wire to terminal marked 48V+
Connect negative (-) wire to terminal marked 48V-
Verify polarity before powering on
Secure all wire connections
Close wiring access panel
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly wired for 48V DC operation

procedures.title: Electric Connection Installation for ZEN 150 48V DC
steps: Locate electric connectors inside the small electric box connected to computer box
Connect power supply from service batteries to terminals - and +
Connect to vessel panel downstream of voltmeter and ammeter on panelboard
Install 25 Ampere automatic circuit breaker on power supply
Select appropriate cable size based on voltage and length according to selection table
Connect negative battery to pump box negative terminal
Connect positive battery to pump box positive terminal
Connect pump box to computer box negative terminal
Connect pump box to computer box positive terminal
Connect P1 from pump box to computer box using 2.5mm² cable
Connect pressure switch signals (PS) to computer box using 2.5mm² cable
Connect electrovalve (EV) to computer box using 2.5mm² cable
Connect remote panel to computer box using supplied pre-wired 10m cable
procedures.expected_outcome: Complete electrical installation with all components properly connected

procedures.title: Cable Selection Procedure
steps: For runs up to 3 meters: Use 10mm² or AWG 7 cable
For runs 3-7 meters: Use 10mm² or AWG 7 cable
For runs 7-10 meters: Use 16mm² or AWG 5 cable
procedures.expected_outcome: Correct cable size selected for installation distance

procedures.title: Starting the Watermaker System
steps: Locate START button on home screen
Press START button
System will run continuously until stopped
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker begins operation

procedures.title: Normal System Shutdown
steps: Press STOP button
Wait 2-3 seconds for internal valve positioning
If automatic washing is enabled, system will perform 1-minute wash cycle
System will shut down
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker stops operation safely

procedures.title: Emergency System Shutdown
steps: Press and hold STOP button for 5 seconds
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker stops immediately

procedures.title: Automatic Washing Cycle
preconditions: System must be in stopped state
steps: Press FLUSH button
System will perform 1-minute washing cycle
procedures.expected_outcome: Washing cycle completed

procedures.title: Waking Display From Sleep Mode
preconditions: Display must be in sleep mode (occurs after 3 minutes of inactivity)
steps: Touch anywhere on the screen
procedures.expected_outcome: Display activates without triggering other commands

procedures.title: Bypass Switch Operation
steps: Verify system is displaying 'SYSTEM BLOCKED' message
Confirm no actual hydraulic issues exist
Activate bypass switch to exclude pressure sensor
Complete one production cycle
Bypass will automatically deactivate after cycle completion
procedures.expected_outcome: System operates for one cycle bypassing pressure sensor

procedures.title: Bypass Valve Operation (Optional)
steps: Activate bypass valve
Fresh water will be diverted to tank regardless of quality
procedures.expected_outcome: All fresh water diverted to tank without quality check

procedures.title: Level Control Setup (Optional)
preconditions: One or two level switches available for fresh water tank
steps: Install level switches in fresh water tank
Enable level control working procedure
System will operate with automatic level control
procedures.expected_outcome: Automatic water level control active

procedures.title: Production Timer Setting
steps: Access the Production Timer control
Press the arrow '>' button to select desired duration
Select between 1-6 hours of operation time
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker operation time is set for selected duration

procedures.title: Automatic Startup Procedure
steps: Open the depressurization valve
Select Automatic Startup function (indicated by YELLOW color)
Wait for system to complete air purging from seawater and washing fresh water hoses
procedures.expected_outcome: System completely purged of air and ready for operation

procedures.title: Periodic Wash Setup
preconditions: Fresh water reservoir contains sufficient water (minimum 20L per cycle)
steps: Activate Periodic Wash function
Verify FLUSH button is illuminated
Confirm countdown appears in Timer box
System will automatically perform 1-minute wash every 6-10 days
procedures.expected_outcome: System scheduled for automatic periodic washing

procedures.title: Manual Wash Operation
steps: Select Manual Wash function
Allow system to run for 10-minute washing cycle
Press STOP if early termination is needed
procedures.expected_outcome: System completes washing cycle

procedures.title: Preliminary Checks Before Start-up
steps: Verify all components and hoses are connected correctly
Verify 5 micron and active carbon cartridges are installed
Check seawater inlet valve and salt water drain valve are open
Check reset valve is closed (lever orthogonal to body valve) and positioner completely unscrewed
Check fresh water pressurizing pump of the boat is on
Check grey valve on active carbon filter is open
procedures.expected_outcome: System ready for start-up procedure

procedures.title: System Start-up Procedure
steps: Open the depressurization valve (unscrew the valve)
Activate start-up procedure through function on second page
Close depressurization valve when display shows specific message
Wait for completion of procedure
procedures.expected_outcome: System successfully started and operational

procedures.title: System Block Reset
steps: Press STOP button to reset system
Investigate potential hydraulic issues
If pressure switch malfunction detected, activate bypass
procedures.expected_outcome: System returns to operational state

procedures.title: Control Cable Verification
steps: Check connection continuity between remote panel and computer box
procedures.expected_outcome: Verified cable connection

procedures.title: Bad Water Quality Response
steps: System displays 'DIVERT TO DISCHARGE'
Fresh water production diverts to discharge for 2:45 minutes
System enters alarm state
Pump group shuts off
procedures.expected_outcome: System safely shut down due to poor water quality

procedures.title: System Status Monitoring
steps: Monitor system status messages on display
Verify 'SYSTEM RUNNING' indicates normal operation
Check 'SYSTEM STOP' indicates ready state
Observe 'TANK FULL / AUTO' indicates standby mode when tank is full
procedures.expected_outcome: Operator understands current system state

procedures.title: Water Quality Monitoring
steps: Monitor salinity probe messages
Wait for 'S = wait' to complete calculations
Check final reading: S = OK, S = MED, or S = BAD
If 'DIVERT TO DISCHARGE' appears, wait 1 minute for water diversion
procedures.expected_outcome: Water quality level confirmed
error_codes: DIVERT TO DISCHARGE - Water diversion active

procedures.title: Warning Message Monitoring
steps: Monitor for orange warning messages
Check for 'BYPASS WARNING' indicating bypass mode
Check for 'DIV. VALVE BY-PASS' indicating disabled salinity probe control
procedures.expected_outcome: Warning conditions identified and understood
error_codes: BYPASS WARNING - System in bypass mode
DIV. VALVE BY-PASS - Salinity probe control disabled

procedures.title: Reset Positioner Knob Operation
preconditions: System must be in default state
steps: Screw the positioner knob clockwise until it reaches maximum position (minimum 18 complete turns)
Unscrew the positioner knob counterclockwise to original position until it stops
Close the reset valve by moving lever to vertical position
procedures.expected_outcome: Positioner knob properly reset and valve closed

procedures.title: Operating in Clean Waters
preconditions: Watermaker must be used in waters with turbidity 5 NTU max
steps: Check water clarity before operation
Ensure operation is away from coral reefs
Verify 5 micron filter is clean and properly installed
Consider installing additional 20 micron pre-filter for harsh conditions
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe operation without particle damage to watermaker

procedures.title: Filter Replacement Procedure
steps: Remove old filter
Clean filter container thoroughly
Prevent particles from entering machine during replacement
Install new 5 micron filter
Verify proper installation
procedures.expected_outcome: New filter properly installed without contamination

procedures.title: Manual Reset Procedure
preconditions: System has high pressure without cycling
Pump shuts off after few seconds
Automatic hydraulic valve stopped in central position
steps: Open the reset valve (move lever to horizontal position)
Open the depressurization valve slightly
procedures.expected_outcome: System reset and proper valve operation restored

procedures.title: System Restart Procedure
preconditions: System must be in stopped state
steps: Restart the system
Wait several seconds
Close the depressurization valve
procedures.expected_outcome: System successfully restarted with depressurization valve closed

procedures.title: Normal Operating Without Final Flushing
preconditions: Reset valve must be closed (lever orthogonal to body valve)
Grey valve on active carbon filter must be open
steps: Press START to turn on the watermaker
Press STOP to turn off the watermaker
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker operates and stops normally

procedures.title: Normal Operating With Final Flushing
preconditions: Reset valve must be closed (lever orthogonal to body valve)
Grey valve on active carbon filter must be open
steps: Press START to turn on the watermaker
Press FLUSH to set the final flushing
Press STOP to turn off the watermaker
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker operates and performs final flush using approximately 20L of fresh water

procedures.title: Working Cycle with Timer
preconditions: Reset valve must be closed (lever orthogonal to body valve)
Grey valve on active carbon filter must be open
steps: Select working time (1-6 hours) using arrow '>' button
Press START to turn on the watermaker
To stop: Press STOP (without flushing) or press FLUSH then STOP (with flushing)
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker operates for selected duration with optional final flush

procedures.title: Long Flushing Procedure
preconditions: Reset valve must be closed (lever orthogonal to body valve)
Grey valve on active carbon filter must be open
steps: Press START in the MANUAL WASH function
Allow 10-minute flushing procedure to complete
Can be stopped at any time by pressing STOP
procedures.expected_outcome: Watermaker performs extended 10-minute flush cycle

procedures.title: Strainer Inspection and Cleaning
preconditions: Access to strainer must be available
steps: Perform visual inspection of strainer
Remove strainer from housing
Wash strainer thoroughly
Reinstall strainer
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean strainer free of debris and contaminants

procedures.title: 5 Micron Cartridge Filter Replacement
steps: Unscrew the filter housing counter clockwise using the provided specific key
Remove old cartridge filter
Install new cartridge filter
Reinstall housing
Open depressurization valve for 2-3 minutes to purge air from system
procedures.expected_outcome: New filter installed and system purged of air

procedures.title: Active Carbon Filter Replacement
steps: Unscrew the filter housing counter clockwise using the provided specific key
Remove old active carbon filter
Install new active carbon filter
Reinstall housing
procedures.expected_outcome: New active carbon filter installed

procedures.title: Shutdown Operating Procedure
preconditions: SC1 or SC2 solution bottle available
steps: Prepare solution by mixing SC1 (or SC2) bottle with 15 litres of unchlorinated water
Connect 3 hoses to the pump and watermaker
Submerge hoses in the prepared solution
Ensure pipes are below the free water surface
Verify hoses are well submerged and not sucking air
Open the depressurization valve
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly shut down and prepared for maintenance

procedures.title: Watermaker Shutdown Procedure Equipment Preparation
preconditions: System must be ready for shutdown
All required equipment must be available
steps: Prepare 15 litre tank of fresh water
Gather 3 hoses for connection to: inlet pump, watermaker discharge, and fresh water out
Obtain bottle of SCHENKER CLEANING 1 (SC1) powder
Prepare SC1 solution according to bottle label instructions using unchlorinated water
Gather necessary tools (screwdrivers, pliers) for pipe dismounting
procedures.expected_outcome: All equipment ready for shutdown procedure

procedures.title: Watermaker Chemical Cleaning - Standard Procedure
steps: Partially open depressurizing knob
Apply SCHENKER CLEANING 1 (SC1) solution
Allow 20 minutes contact time
Flush system
Replace filters with new ones (if continuing operation)
Remove filters if storing for extended period
procedures.expected_outcome: System cleaned and prepared for storage

procedures.title: Watermaker Chemical Cleaning - Organic Contamination Procedure
preconditions: Both SC1 and SC2 solutions available
steps: Partially open depressurizing knob
Apply SCHENKER CLEANING 2 (SC2) solution first
Allow 20 minutes contact time
Flush system with fresh water
Apply SCHENKER CLEANING 1 (SC1) solution
Allow 20 minutes contact time
Leave SC1 in system for winterization
Replace filters with new ones (if continuing operation)
Remove filters if storing for extended period
procedures.expected_outcome: System cleaned of organic contamination and prepared for storage

procedures.title: Air Purge Procedure
steps: Locate the depressurization valve
Open the valve slightly
Keep valve open for 2-3 minutes
Close the valve
procedures.expected_outcome: Air removed from system

procedures.title: Working Pressure Check
steps: Check pressure reading on main unit manometer
Verify pressure is within 10-11 bar range
Note any pressure peaks during commutation (should be 0.4 bar)
If pressure exceeds normal range, check membrane cleanliness
If pressure is high, perform SC1 chemical cleaning
If SC1 cleaning insufficient, perform SC2 alkaline washing
procedures.expected_outcome: Pressure confirmed within operational range

procedures.title: Leak Check Procedure
steps: Inspect all hoses for bursting
Check all hose clamps for tightness
Examine equipment for failures
Look for any water leakage
procedures.expected_outcome: No leaks detected in system

procedures.title: Membrane Replacement Check
steps: Monitor water quality
Check working pressure
Perform chemical washings if needed
If no improvement after washing, replace membranes
Replace membranes every 6-7 years on average
procedures.expected_outcome: Membrane condition verified or replaced

procedures.title: Long-term Shutdown Procedure
steps: Flush system to remove organic sediments
Flush system to remove inorganic sediments
Apply bacterial growth inhibitor
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly prepared for long-term storage

procedures.title: Watermaker Restart After Shutdown
preconditions: Watermaker must be in shutdown state
steps: Start the watermaker with by-pass activated
Run unit for approximately 20 minutes
Ensure hoses are properly positioned in recipient to avoid air intake
Stop the unit
Reconnect original hoses
procedures.expected_outcome: System purged of air and chemicals

procedures.title: Antifreeze Winterizing Procedure
preconditions: Normal shutdown procedure with SC1 must be completed first
steps: Prepare solution by mixing propylene glycol with 15 litres of unchlorinated water (45% concentration for temperatures to -20°C, 55% for temperatures to -30°C)
Disconnect the drain hose and the pumps suction hose
Connect two hose pieces to the drain and to the pump suction
Insert the end side of the hoses into the bucket with solution
Verify hoses are properly dipped in solution and don't inhale air
Open the depressurization valve
Start the watermaker
Leave unit running for approximately 5 minutes
Stop the unit
Connect the original hoses while ensuring system remains filled with antifreeze solution
procedures.expected_outcome: System properly winterized with antifreeze solution

procedures.title: Safety Warnings for Antifreeze Procedure
steps: Read manual instructions carefully before any service
Never use ethylene glycol as antifreeze solution
Use only propylene glycol solution
Ensure proper concentration based on temperature requirements
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe execution of winterizing procedure

procedures.title: Membrane Replacement
preconditions: Chemical washing did not improve performance
steps: Replace reverse osmosis membranes
procedures.expected_outcome: Restored water quality and normal working pressure

procedures.title: Pump High Pressure Switch Calibration
steps: Pull out the plug
Remove the security nut
Engage the small internal screw with screwdriver
Turn clockwise to increase pressure calibration
Turn counterclockwise to decrease pressure calibration
procedures.expected_outcome: Pressure switch calibrated to approximately 15 Bar

procedures.title: Accumulator Pressure Check
steps: Check accumulator pressure level periodically
Verify pressure is maintained at approximately 5 bar
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper pressure damping during watermaker operation

procedures.title: Short Term Cruising Spare Parts Preparation
steps: Obtain SC1 cleaning product
Obtain SC2 cleaning product
Obtain one 5 microns cartridge filter
procedures.expected_outcome: Essential spare parts ready for short term cruising

procedures.title: Long Term Cruising Spare Parts Preparation
steps: Obtain three 5 microns cartridge filters
Obtain one active carbon filter
Obtain one cleaning kit (SC1+SC2)
Obtain one pump pressure switch
Consider additional recommended parts: pump head, membrane 4021, portable salinity tester, pressure switches, spare seals kit
procedures.expected_outcome: Complete spare parts kit ready for long term cruising

procedures.title: Pump Start Failure Resolution
steps: Check pump pressure switch connection
Replace pressure switch if burned
If electronic failure detected, start pump using microswitches
Start electrovalve using microswitches
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump starts normally

procedures.title: High Pressure System Block Resolution
preconditions: Pump starts but system blocks in high pressure
steps: Identify hydraulic block
Perform system reset procedure
Check and replace dirty filters if necessary
procedures.expected_outcome: System operates without blocking

procedures.title: Pump Start/Stop Cycling Fix
preconditions: Pump temporarily switches off during operation
steps: Check pump pressure switch calibration
Adjust and calibrate pump pressure switch
procedures.expected_outcome: Pump operates continuously without cycling

procedures.title: High Pressure Variations Resolution
steps: Clean or replace dirty filters
Clean or replace dirty membranes
Check accumulator pressure
Inflate accumulator to 5 Bar pressure if low
procedures.expected_outcome: Stable pressure during operation

procedures.title: Low Production with Normal/Low Pressure Fix
preconditions: Low production with normal or low pressure
steps: Check battery charge level
Purge air from system by opening pressure valve temporarily
procedures.expected_outcome: Normal production levels restored

procedures.title: Low Production with High Pressure Resolution
steps: Check for clogged filters
Replace clogged filters
Check for clogged membranes
Perform membrane washing with SC1 if clogged
procedures.expected_outcome: Normal production levels restored
